text: Celeste Martins Caeiro (2 May 1933 – 15 November 2024), also known as Celeste dos Cravos ("Celeste of the carnations"), was a Portuguese pacifist. Her actions are the reason why the 1974 coup is called the Carnation Revolution. Caeiro was born in Lisbon, Portugal. Caeiro died on the 15 November 2024 at a hospital in Leiria, Portugal from respiratory and heart failure, aged 91.Portugal’s ‘Carnations Lady’ who gave name to 1974 revolution dies at 91 swissinfo ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Portuguese activists Category:People from Lisbon Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Deaths from heart failure
title: Celeste Caeiro
